body.h2: Proofreading Output for Inscriptions of Israel/Palestine
body.p: This page will show you the values you have encoded for inscription metadata and transcription, in a format that makes proofreading easier. Please make sure that your file is valid before proofreading. The proofreading script does not check for validity. Also, note that all items in the list below that are preceded by an asterisk (*) are required. If nothing shows up in the proofreading page, you should go back and check your xml file, and either add missing information or, if the information is there, make sure that it is encoded correctly.

*Title: Inscriptions of Israel/Palestine
*Machine-Readable (safe) Title: ashk0003a
*Human-Readable Title: Ashk 0003a

Contents (<msItem>):
*Main Language: la [grc = Greek, la = Latin, heb = Hebrew ]
Other Languages:
*Genre (<class>): (#place_marker.milestone)
*Religion (<ana>): ,
Summary: Ashkelon, 218 CE - 222 CE. Column. Milestone.

Physical Description
*Type of Object <objectDesc>/@ana): #column
*Type of Material (<supportDesc/@ana): #marble
Details:
*Dimensions: Height - 146cm / Width - 51cm / Depth - cm
*Condition (@ana): #complete.broken
Condition Details: Roughly cut at one end and broken at the other. It cannot be determined whether this milestone had a base. The upper end of the column seems to have been leveled intentionally

Layout Description (Columns and Written Lines not required if not applicable. In that case, put info in the Details box)
*Columns: 1
*Written Lines: 8
Details The text covers more than one half of the column's lenght

Hand Description
*HandNote @ana: #impressed.inscribed
HandNote Gloss: Line 1 is 8 cm high, while lines 2-8 range from 5 to 6 cm in height.

History
Origin:
*Date: 218 CE - 222 CE [NotBefore 0218 - NotAfter 0222]
Location:
*Region: Coastal Plain
*City: Ashkelon
*Site: Third Mile Estate
Locus:
Provenance:
PlaceName:

*Bibliography
xml:id of work cited: b1
IIP ID of work cited: IIP-703.xml
Citation: 223
Check Entries
Source of Diplomatic: b1
Source of Transcription: b1
Source of Translation: b1
Source of Commentary: b1

div.p:
Imp (eratori) C[a]es (ari) divi Ant[o]nini ma-
ioris pi[i] [f]i[l] (io) , (divi) Severi pii
nep (oti) , Marco [Au]relio
⟦ Anto (nino) ⟧ Pio felici (invicto)
Aug (usto) tr (ibuniciae) p (otestatis)
via (s) et p[on]t (es) restituit
mi (lia) p (assuum) III

To the Emperor Caesar, son of the divine Antoninus the Greater, Pius, grandson of the (divine) Severus, Pius, Marcus Aurelius [[Antoninus Pius]], fortunate, invincible, holder of the tribunician power. He restored the roads and bridges. Three miles.
